data.name: N-Fibonacci: Forwards and Backwards
data.description:
Task

Given an array of starting values `start`: 1. Write a generator function `forward` which generates the values `start[0], start[1], ..., start[i]`, and each element following that is the sum of the previous `n` elements, where `n` is the length of `start`, indefinitely. 2. Write a generator function `backward` which generates the values `start[i], start[i-1], ..., start[0]` and each element following that is a number `x` such that `x` and the following `n-1` elements sum to the number preceding `x`, where `n` is the length of `start`, indefinitely The numbers in `start` will be `BigInt`s. Your code **should not mutate** `start`. * * *

Example:

Input: [5n, 7n, 3n]
First 10 values of forward: [5n, 7n, 3n, 15n, 25n, 43n, 83n, 151n, 277n, 511n]
First 10 values of backward: [3n, 7n, 5n, -9n, 11n, 3n, -23n, 31n, -5n, -49n]
* * *

Tests

The numbers in the `start` array will always be integers. The program will test anywhere between `800` and `1000` numbers in both directions. The random tests will be of `start` length `n` in the range `0 < n <= 25`. There will be `100` random tests for each direction. * * *

Helpful Links

Generator Functions Fibonacci Numbers
